title: Keen QED music is actually a real song!
content:
Well, I never knew this before, but the music playing in the Quantum Explosion Dynamo (Keen 5 level 12) is actually a piece of classical music! It was composed by [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gustav_Holst]Gustav Holst[/url] from his orchestral suite [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Planets]The Planets[/url]. The excerpt they used in the QED was from "Mars - The Bringer of War."

For those of you who don't have access to a large classical music collection, here's a sample from the European Philharmonic Orchestra (cut to about one-minute long to keep things legal.)

[url=http://www.shikadi.net/pckf/holst-mars.ogg]holst-mars.ogg[/url] (1MB)

Interesting![url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Keen QED music is actually a real song!
content:
Whoa! Very good find there! Sounds like a good piece, too.

Now I'm reminded of Korobushka, the "Tetris theme". [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mischief.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Keen QED music is actually a real song!
content:
Yep, I knew that. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Its presented pretty well in Keen's music format, too.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Keen QED music is actually a real song!
content:
Yeah, I was also aware of that. Thought it was more or less common knowledge. It's turned up in a couple of threads over the past few years.

Perhaps this detail should be added to the Keen Wiki.

title: Re: Keen QED music is actually a real song!
content:
Oh, I've never read about it before. I just added it to the wiki (on the QED level page.)

Are there any other songs in the Keen soundtrack that are based on existing tunes?[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Keen QED music is actually a real song!
content:
I didn't know. Interesting.
But it was somewhat expected, because IIRC in Wikipedia it's mentioned that Bobby Prince used to "imitate" existing pieces in such a way it could not be illegal to do it.

And guess who composed the music for the Keen: Galaxy trilogy.------------------------------

title: Re: Keen QED music is actually a real song!
content:
Well Bobby Prince had all the right to use it. Being made so long ago (1916, IIRC), it is now public domain.
Apparently, it's also in Mario Bros 3, but I've never heard it, or anything too similar...
It was in that trailer for The Golden Compass.
The theme for Jupiter was also in a Reese's commercial.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Planets_in_popular_culture]en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The...ar_culture[/url]

Haha, these songs are everywhere. Its fun to find them, too, cause I'll be like "Hey, I know this song!!", but no one really ever cares... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] -Genius314

title: Re: Keen QED music is actually a real song!
content:
It's a very suitable song too for this particular level and I'm sure it was done on purpose, the level itself is red and will be used for multiple genocide. (Is it a war when nobody gets a chance to fight back?)[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!

title: Re: Keen QED music is actually a real song!
content:
I think it sounds pretty similar, actually. There may be an extra note added somewhere, but otherwise it's very close (to my ears at least).--------------------
[url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/]Cerebral Cortex 314[/url] - For All of your Commander Keen Needs.
[url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/dave/joes.html]Eat at Joes[/url]

title: Hehe
content:
It's as close as you can get, while adhering to the 4 note polyphony of the ol' Adlib cards.

I disagree about Mario's airship being an arrangement of Mars, though. It might be ~influenced,~ but it's far from an arrangement.

title: Re: Hehe
content:
Um... great song. Interesting how the IMF tune sounds almost exactly like the original.------------------------------

title: t3h pl4n3tz
content: I am a great fan of the entire Planets Suite by Holst, and I remember my surprise at hearing the QED music and how it was an alteration of the Mars theme.  I'm surprised nobody has pointed it out yet.[img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]
